lines.content: * Represents the main class for the Duke chatbot application.
* Greets the user, handles user interactions, and displays farewell message upon exit.
* Entry point of the Duke application.
* Represents a custom exception specific to the Duke chatbot application.
* Constructs a DukeException with the specified error message.
* @param msg The error message associated with the exception.
* Returns a formatted string representation of the exception.
* @return A formatted string containing the error message.
* Reads and processes the user command.

* Handles saving and loading tasks to/from a file.
* Saves the list of tasks to a serialized file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Loads tasks from a serialized file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file is not found.
* Represents the user interface for interacting with the task list.
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added.
* @param taskCount The current number of tasks in the list.
public static void addTask(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as done.
System.out.println(" Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as not done.
System.out.println(" OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been deleted.
* @param count The updated number of tasks in the list.
public static void deleteTask(Task task, int count) {
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + (count - 1) + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that no existing tasks were found.
System.out.println("No existing tasks, creating new task list...");
* Displays matching tasks based on a keyword search.
* @param tasks The list of matching tasks.
System.out.println(" Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Displays the list of tasks in the task list.
* @param taskList The task list to display.
System.out.println(" Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays an error message for a DukeException.
* Represents a task with a description, completion status, and a deadline date.
* Constructs a deadline task with the specified description and deadline date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The deadline date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including its completion status icon, description, and deadline date.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Represents a task with a description, completion status, and an event duration.
* Constructs an event task with the specified description, start date, and end date.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from The start date of the event in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* @param to The end date of the event in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task, including its completion status icon, description, start date, and end date.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns an icon representing the completion status of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " (space) if the task is not done.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Checks if the task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its completion status icon and description.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manage tasks.
* Constructs a TaskList by loading tasks from storage (if available).
* If storage is not available, displays a message indicating no tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list and updates storage.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The number of tasks in the task list.
* Retrieves a task from the task list at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Marks a task as done at the specified index and updates storage.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as done.
* Marks a task as not done at the specified index and updates storage.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as not done.
* Deletes a task at the specified index, updates task count, and updates storage.
* @param index The index of the task to delete.
* Searches for tasks containing the specified keyword and displays the found tasks.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* Represents a to-do task with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a to-do task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Returns a string representation of the to-do task, including its completion status icon and description.
* @return A formatted string representing the to-do task.
